result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cole G Steward

records.addlTxt:
8:47 AM Defendant Cole G Steward in court.  Attorney John Thomas Bayer in court for Cole G Steward.  Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Defense is requesting one more status date.
Defense wants time to review the body camera footage.
BTC: Matters adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Notice of Intent to introduce Deft's statements
State's Notice of Intent to introduce expert testimony
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE
Status conference on September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.

2:20 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly Larsen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cole G Steward in court.  Attorney John Thomas Bayer in court for Cole G Steward. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
